All fertilizations were conducted within 30 min after stripping. Each egg batch was split in half and fertilized using filtered and ultraviolet (UV)–sterilized seawater (34 PSU) previously adjusted to the broodstock holding temperature (Atlantic cod: 5°C; Polar cod: 3°C) and two different P co 2 conditions [control P co 2: 400 μatm, pH (Free-Scale) 8.15; high P co 2: 1100 μatm, pH F 7.77]. A standardized dry fertilization protocol with milt aliquots from n = 3 males was used to maximize fertilization success (
32 ).
